title: Santos set to buy ConocoPhillips' northern Australian assets
text:
Santos is poised to acquire US major ConocoPhillips' northern Australian gas assets and business for $US1.5 billion ($2.2 billion) after months of secret talks, Street Talk can reveal.

Santos has entered into a sale-and-purchase agreement to buy the bulk of Conoco's portfolio which includes the Darwin LNG plant and the Barossa gas venture off the coast.

Korea's SK Group is also involved in the transaction, sources said.

A sale by the US oil and gas producer tp Kevin Gallagher-run Santos. could present an opportunity for a radical overhaul of the Darwin LNG plant’s ownership. Supplied

It is understood SK is selling down to Santos a 25 per cent interest in Darwin LNG.

SK is advised by JPMorgan while Credit Suisse and JB North & Co are tending to Santos.
description: Santos is poised to acquire US major ConocoPhillips' northern Australian assets for $US1.5 billion ($2.2 billion) after months of secret talks, Street Talk can reveal.
